bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Letter from [Philip Showalter Hench] to Helen Wheeler, October 21, 1940

div1.p: Hench informs Wheeler that he will return the material he has used but would like to keep the rest longer.

div1.head: Letter from [Philip Showalter Hench] to Helen Wheeler, October 21, 1940
div1.opener:
October 21, 1940
Miss Helen Wheeler
Welch Medical Library
The Johns Hopkins University
1900 E. Monument Street
Baltimore, Md.
My dear Miss Wheeler:
div1.p:
I appreciate very greatly your courtesy
in sending me the interesting yellow fever material from your
library. I have gone over about half of it thoroughly but have
been so busy I have not gotten over the rest. I think it best
to return to you at once that which I have gone over, and hope
that I may keep the other for a while longer. Do I have your
permission to copy or photostat parts of it? It will be most
useful in the preparation of my own paper on these experiments.
When I have gotten my data together I shall be glad to send you
a list of the material I have found, and should you wish to
copy it, I shall be only too glad to have it available through
your library.
